summary: This is an email chain between attorneys at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP and federal prosecutors from the SDNY, discussing the scheduling of interviews and investigative steps related to a civil lawsuit filed on behalf of an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails cover coordination for meetings with the victim, contact with family members, and media coverage of the lawsuit.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP corresponding with SDNY prosecutors about scheduling interviews with his client, an alleged Epstein victim, and discussing the civil lawsuit he filed.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP copied on emails discussing the SDNY investigation and scheduling.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP mentioned in the correspondence and copied on some emails.

persons.name: John Koeltl
persons.context: Identified as the judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by Robert Glassman's firm.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Identified as the magistrate judge assigned to the civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator of the alleged abuse against the victim represented by Glassman.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the context of specific conduct to be discussed regarding the victim's allegations.

connections.description: Attorneys at the same law firm (Panish Shea & Boyle LLP) working on the same case.
Attorneys at the same law firm, with Boyle copied on key correspondence.
Glassman is representing a victim in a civil lawsuit against Epstein's estate.
Judge and magistrate judge assigned to the same civil case.

events.title: Civil lawsuit filed against Epstein
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of an alleged Epstein victim, which is subsequently covered by media outlets.

events.title: Media coverage of lawsuit
events.description: The New York Daily News, New York Post, The Sun, and Daily Mail publish stories about the newly filed civil lawsuit alleging abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Meeting with victim and SDNY
events.description: A meeting is scheduled between the victim, her attorney Robert Glassman, and SDNY prosecutors to discuss the case details, including travel and conduct by Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Proposed interview date
events.description: Robert Glassman proposes the week of February 24, 2020, for SDNY prosecutors to interview his client, as it is better for her schedule.

locations: 11111 Santa Monica Boulevard, Suite 700 Los Angeles, CA 90025
keyFacts: A civil lawsuit was filed on January 17, 2020, by attorney Robert Glassman on behalf of a woman alleging she was abused by Jeffrey Epstein at age 13.
The SDNY investigation team was actively seeking to interview the victim and her family members (mother, siblings) for corroboration in late 2019 and early 2020.
The case was assigned to Judge John Koeltl and Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses in the SDNY.
The victim's mother was reported to be living overseas, not in the United States, as of December 2019.
The email chain reveals coordination and sometimes tension between civil attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding the timing of filings and investigative steps.
